column4: hey folks! I've a problem installing ubuntu on laptop with a fancy chipset...  I'm trying to boot with noapic nolapic
have you tried disabling the module that it hangs on?
how can I know which module hangs ?
you said it hangs right after the usbcore stuff, have you tried disabling usb?
it was working with these parameters with 7.04... but now with 7.10 no luck.

i'm using a turtlebeach usb audio and just installed ubuntu 7.1 last night. I launch firefox and install the flash player inside firefox, but i get no sound. i checked the sound properties and selected "usb" for everything and clicked test to make sure i heard something. i drop to shell and apt-get remove flashplugin-nonfree and then install it again. still no sound.
download an older version then just upgrade through apt
no takers on the audio problem?
weird, I do not see any usb options to disable it.
in suse you would just type nousb as a parameter for boot option
i'm not sure what it would be for ubuntu, i'm new too :)
at least i'm trying to help... nobody wants to answer my question :)
